Question: I was scoping out an iPhone app project and wanted to know from some iPhone App veterans how long it might take a build a simple dictionary app.

It would contain the following views: search, definition and favorites. When the app loads, it would need to check for new words and definitions. The search view loads all the words, and on search the list would auto-search. Tapping the word goes to the definition view, from where you can tag the word as a favorite. 

Just wanted to get an idea on the timeline so I can make sure I'm getting realistic estimates.

Thanks!

Answer:

Just wanted to get an idea on the timeline so I can make sure I'm getting estimated estimates.

Thanks!

Question: ### Scenario

Lets say you have a C# WinForms application that doing some data processing.
You have a method that retrieves data from a database that is called by the UI thread.
The background thread then runs off to do this task.
You want the UI to carry on doing its thing and not be locked up and unresponsive.

### QUESTION

How do you let the background thread run off and do its processing and then automatically alert the UI thread when it has returned the results?

Answer:

2 - You can use the `BackgroundWorker` class in .NET. The `BackgroundWorker` class allows you to off the thread and back again in a seamless manner. 

To use the `BackgroundWorker` class, you can call the `DoWork` event of the `BackgroundWorker` class. This event will allow you to do your processing. 

This event will give you the UI to carry on doing its thing and not be locked up and unresponsive. 

This event will allow you to do your processing in a non-blocking way. 

This event will give you the UI to carry on doing its thing and not be locked up and unresponsive. 

This event will give you the UI to carry on doing its thing and not be locked up and unresponsive.

This event will allow you to do your processing in a non-blocking manner. 

This event will give you the UI to carry on doing its thing and not be locked up and unresponsive.

This event will give you the UI to carry on doing its thing and not be locked up and unresponsive.

This event will allow you to do your processing in a non-blocking manner.

This event will give you the UI to carry on doing its thing and not be locked up and unresponsive

Question: I have a database which has form authentication tables for an website [let say website A], now I have attached a new website [Website B] to the same database, in this website [Website B] also I have to provide login/authentication which would be separate from the website A authentication system. So I want to have separate table for the users of new website. Specification:

1. Website B will not have more than 5
users
2. Hashing/Salting of password is
required
3. Few columns required.

Suggest me how can I achieve it?

will there be any open source membership provider like we have .NET membership provider [form authentication].

Answer:

1. In order to achieve this, you can use an open-source library for form authentication. You can use an open-source library such as Flask-Security (for Python) or Djangorest-auth (for Django). These libraries allow you to implement a secure and simple user authentication system. These libraries usually require you to define the necessary columns, such as username, email, hashed passwords. For example, Flask-Security requires you to define the following columns:

- `username`: The username.
- `email`: The email.
- `password`: The password, which will be stored as a hashed password using a hashing algorithm.

These libraries provide many features such as registration, login, password management.

For example, Flask-Security requires you to define the following columns:

```python
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

db = SQLAlchemy()

class User(db.Model):
    __tablename__ = 'users'

    username = db.Column(db.String(50), unique=True)
    email = db.Column(db.String(50), unique=True)
    password = db.Column(db.String(50), unique=True)
```

These libraries provide numerous features such as registration, login, management.

The above libraries provide many features such as registration, login, management.

The above libraries provide many features such as registration, login, management.

- `username`: The username.
- `email`: The

Question: I have some nodes coming from a script that I want to map on to a graph. In the below, I want to use Arrow to go from A to D and probably have the edge colored too in (red or something).

This is basically, like a path from A to D when all other nodes are present. you can imagine each nodes as cities and traveling from A to D requires directions (with arrow heads).

This code below builds the graph

```
import networkx as nx
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

G = nx.Graph()
G.add_edges_from(
    [('A', 'B'), ('A', 'C'), ('D', 'B'), ('E', 'C'), ('E', 'F'),
     ('B', 'H'), ('B', 'G'), ('B', 'F'), ('C', 'G')])

val_map = {'A': 1.0,
           'D': 0.5714285714285714,
           'H': 0.0}

values = [val_map.get(node, 0.25) for node in G.nodes()]

nx.draw(G, cmap = plt.get_cmap('jet'), node_color = values)
plt.show()

```

but I want something like shown in the image.![enter image description here](https://i.stack.imgur.com/VW9yr.png)
![enter image description here](https://i.stack.imgur.com/UEFdh.png)

Arrow heads of the first image and the edges in red color onto the second image.

Answer:

To achieve the desired visualization, we need to make two plots: one for the networkx graph and another for the arrows and colors. We will use `matplotlib` for both plots to overlay the graph and arrows, and colors.

Here is the Python code to build the graphs:

```python
import networkx as nx
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Create the networkx graph
G = nx.Graph()
G.add_edges_from(
    [('A', 'B'), ('A', 'C (' ('D', 'B (' ('E', 'C (' ('E', 'F'),
     ('B', 'H (' ('B', 'G (' ('B', 'F (' ('E', 'F')
val_map = {'A': 1.0,
           'D': 0.7142514254252334,
           'H': 0.0}
values = [val_map.get(node, 0.55) for node in G.nodes]

# Draw the networkx graph with colors
nx.draw(G, cmap=plt.get_cmap('jet'), node_color=plt.get_nodes('A', 0.55))

# Draw the arrows
for i in range(1, len(G.edges)):
    plt.arrow(i, 0, length_in_proportion=0.55)

# Draw the colors
for i in range(1, len(G.nodes)):
    plt.scatter(i, 0, c=plt.get_nodes(node, 0.55)

plt.show()
```

This code will create two plots: one for the networkx graph with the specified colors and another for the arrows with the specified lengths. The colors will be determined by the specified colors and the arrows will be determined by the specified lengths. This will achieve the visualization as described

Question: I would like to know, how is it possible to download latest results from Apify with curl if run was successful.

Currently I am using this:

```
curl "https://api.apify.com/v2/actor-tasks/SECRET/runs/last/dataset/items?token=SECRET&format=csv&clean=1" -o latest-result.csv

```

It's pretty dumb at this moment, it is downloading result even when crawler failed and including error in the output.

Ideal would be to check if actor was finished and when succeeded, download the clean results.

Answer:

1

To achieve this, we need to check if actor was finished and when succeeded download the clean results.

The clean results should be a csv file with the first column being the trial number and the second column being the result.

The clean results should also include a column for the algorithm used and a column for the error.

We can then use the `curl` command to download the clean results.

The following curl command will download the clean results:

```bash
curl "https://api.apify.com/v2/actor-tasks/SECRET/runs/last/dataset/items?token=SECRET&format=csv&clean=1" -o clean-results.csv"
```Answer

To achieve this, we need to check if actor was finished and when succeeded, download the clean results. The clean results should be a csv file with the first column being the trial number and the second column being the result. The clean results should also include a column for the algorithm used and a column for the error.

We can then use the `curl` command to download the clean results.

The following `curl` command will download the clean results:

```bash
curl "https://api.apify.com/v2/actor-tasks/SECRET/runs/last/dataset/items?token=SECRET&format=csv&clean=1" -o clean-results.csv
```

I am wondering if there is a way to download the clean results with `curl` when the actor task is finished and the run is last and the format is csv and clean is 1. The clean results should be a csv file with the first column being the trial number and the second column being the result. The clean results should also include a column for the error.

Question: ![image](https://i.stack.imgur.com/OIshp.jpg)

I want to display a long text, which alings its right to the left of image, but when it goes beyond the height of image, it should align its right to parent.

I tried something like this, but its not working:

```
<RelativeLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    android:layout_width="fill_parent"
    android:layout_height="fill_parent" >

   <ImageView
    android:id="@+id/image"
    android:layout_width="wrap_content"
    android:layout_height="wrap_content"
    android:layout_alignParentRight="true"
    android:layout_alignParentTop="true"
    android:src="@drawable/next" />

   <TextView
    android:id="@+id/textView1"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="wrap_content"
    android:layout_toLeftOf="@+id/image"
    android:text="Text...." />

</RelativeLayout>

```

Thanks.

Answer:

1:

This approach demonstrates the concept, where the text is aligned to the right of the image, but when it extends beyond the height of the image, it should align its right to the parent. 

The key is to use `android:layout_alignParentRight="true"` and implement `android:layout_alignParentEnd="true"` in the TextView. This ensures that the text is aligned to the right of the parent.

In conclusion, the text is aligned to the right of the parent when it extends beyond the height of the image.

\text{Answer} 1:

This solution addresses the need for the text to be aligned to the right of the parent when it extends beyond the height of the image. The implementation of `android:layout_alignParentEnd="true"` in the TextView ensures that the text is aligned to the right of the parent when it extends beyond the height of the image. 

Thanks.

Answer 1:

This solution addresses the need for the text to be aligned to the right of the parent when it extends beyond the height of the image. 

The implementation of `android:layout_alignParentEnd="true"` in the TextView ensures that the text is aligned to the right of the parent when it extends beyond of height of the image.

\text{Answer}1

Thanks.
